real=

presentation sounds pretty far fetched to me.  (Is that
edit link for the r=
equested resource, or is it for a different
resource whose information is c=
ontained in the requested one.)

The `<{name} href=3D""/>` pattern promotes=

item to the highest possible level.  This incre=
ases the clarity of the
representation.  As a client writer i care about se=
mantics of the
various parts of the representations far more than i care ab=
out their
types.  I can guess with little effort that an element named 'edi=
t'
will contain a link.  With a link element i must scan to the right
until=
 i find the @rel in order to understand the purpose of the

ake clarity over vague, unrealistic, promises of

we have the link header[1] which is better, in every

tom:link for expressing common relations.  It
